entry.title: Federal Reserve Releases New Guidelines for Crypto Banks
entry.summary: The announcement could make it possible for American crypto banks to perform both crypto and traditional banking functions.

entry.title: Decrypt on the Street: An NFT Trip to Tiffany's, a Search for Status
entry.summary: In this episode of Decrypt on the Street, reporter Sander Lutz jumps through hoops in the hopes of obtaining an exclusive "NFTiff" from Tiffany & Co. Sander learns manners and spiritual awareness from two coaches, only to fall short of the digital brass ring.

entry.title: The Electronic Frontier Foundation Is ‘Deeply Concerned’ About Tornado Cash Ban
entry.summary: Digital privacy advocates and other crypto services say regulators “overstepped” in sanctioning the coin mixer.

entry.title: Why NFT Creators and Collectors Can’t Stop Talking About Artist Royalties
entry.summary: Some NFT marketplaces aren’t honoring creator royalties, setting off an animated conversation across Crypto Twitter this weekend. Here's what all the fuss is about.

entry.title: Nasdaq-Listed Eqonex Shuts Down Crypto Exchange Due to Low Volume, 'Intense Competition'
entry.summary: The company will redirect resources toward its crypto custody and asset management businesses from here on.

entry.title: BitGo to Sue Galaxy Digital for Pulling Out of Acquisition Deal
entry.summary: Galaxy Digital today said it would no longer acquire BitGo in what would have been a massive deal in the crypto world. BitGo is now suing.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Bitfarms Posts $142M Loss in Q2 as Rising Energy Prices Bite
entry.summary: The company acquired 9,000 new mining rigs and increased its hash rate, but lagging Bitcoin prices still hurt its bottom line.

entry.title: Coin Center Says It May Challenge Tornado Cash Ban in Court
entry.summary: The non-profit advocacy group says the ban may be unconstitutional.

entry.title: Galaxy Digital Pulls Plug on $1.2 Billion BitGo Acquisition
entry.summary: Mike Novogratz’s Galaxy Digital will not pursue its planned acquisition of crypto custody firm BitGo, it announced today.

entry.title: Acala Exploit Causes Polkadot-Based DeFi Platform’s Stablecoin to Drop 99%
entry.summary: Hackers used an exploit to mint 1.28 billion aUSD tokens, prompting the stablecoin to lose its peg to the U.S. dollar.

entry.title: Monero Rolls Out Enhanced Privacy Features With Hard Fork
entry.summary: Privacy coin Monero has deployed a non-contentious hard fork to boost its privacy and security feature set.

entry.title: Ethereum Slumps 5% as Merge Surge Falters
entry.summary: After reclaiming the $2,000 level last week amid mounting anticipation for its upcoming Merge event, Ethereum has slipped over the past 24 hours.

entry.title: SHIB Spikes on Sunday, Dogecoin Climbs
entry.summary: With $3.41 billion in trading volume over the last 24 hours, SHIB hit highs not seen since May.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Tornado Cash Sanctions Slammed, Vitalik Criticizes MakerDAO Proposal
entry.summary: The prices of leading cryptocurrencies began to rebound, but the state of the industry still gave Crypto Twitter plenty to criticize.

entry.title: Brother Bing’s Guide to Surviving the Crypto Bear Market
entry.summary: Yes, Virginia, there is such a thing as “productive capitulation.” Here's how to get realistic and efficient about bearing this bear market.

entry.title: War on Crypto! From Ethereum Mixers to Media Newsletters
entry.summary: The Feds sanctioning Tornado Cash and the deplatforming of crypto content creators by Mailchimp were the latest signs of a broader anti-crypto wave.

entry.title: Bitcoin Tops $25K for First Time in 9 Weeks
entry.summary: The price of the biggest cryptocurrency by market cap finally resurfaced above the $25,000 mark—then quickly sank back.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Ethereum and Avalanche Rally, Crypto Winter Still Not Over
entry.summary: Leading coins rose in anticipation of the Ethereum merge. But there are still signs of ongoing liquidity problems in the industry.

entry.title: Crackdown on Tornado Cash Was Just Round 1
entry.summary: Since Monday's crackdown on Torndao Cash, the DeFi sector is faced with a choice: remain proudly non-compliant or bend the knee.

entry.title: Ethereum Tops $2,000 as Network Approaches Merge Event
entry.summary: The Merge is right around the corner in September, and Ethereum believers are showing their excitement by buying up ETH.

entry.title: Tornado Cash Ethereum Token TORN Down 50% After Sanctions
entry.summary: The coin mixer’s governance token price has steadily declined since regulators took action on Monday.

entry.title: Bitcoin’s Privacy Problem—And What Cypherpunks Are Doing to Solve It
entry.summary: Bitcoin transactions are easily traced. Here’s what’s going on behind the scenes to change that.

entry.title: OpenSea Changes Stolen NFT Policy Following User Outcry
entry.summary: The top marketplace will require a police report for NFTs that are said to be stolen, and is considering further tweaks.

entry.title: What Are Coin Mixers and How Do They Work?
entry.summary: Tornado Cash and similar services have “mixed” billions of dollars in cryptocurrency—much of it for legitimate uses, but some to hide funds stolen by hackers.

entry.title: CFTC Files Charges Against $12 Million 'Bitcoin Ponzi Scheme'
entry.summary: The CFTC claims an Ohio man and his associates used would-be investors’ cash and Bitcoin to fund a lavish lifestyle.

entry.title: gm: Sam Bankman-Fried, Crypto Savior?
entry.summary: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried is the man of the moment in crypto as he has bailed out multiple insolvent companies. Some are calling him Atlas, some sarcastically calling him savior. Sam answers tough questions from Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott on FTX's bailout strategy, the controversial Voyager loan, his market outlook, marketing mistakes by crypto lenders, FTX competitors Binance and Coinbase, his political donations, and what he's learned about management.

entry.title: Tornado DAO Grapples With Arrests as Discord, Governance Forum Go Dark
entry.summary: Before the governance forum was taken down, the community approved a proposal to switch to a 4 of 6 multisignature on its $22 million treasury.

entry.title: 'Welcome to the War on Code': Crypto Twitter Reacts to Arrest of Alleged Tornado Cash Dev
entry.summary: The wider crypto community has erupted on Twitter following the news of an alleged Tornado Cash developer’s arrest in the Netherlands.

entry.title: Dutch Police Arrest Alleged Tornado Cash Dev, More Arrests 'Not Ruled Out': Financial Crimes Unit
entry.summary: A suspected developer of Ethereum mixing service Tornado Cash has been arrested in the Netherlands, with more arrests "not ruled out."

entry.title: Huobi Chief in Talks to Sell $1 Billion Stake in Crypto Exchange: Report
entry.summary: Sam Bankman-Fried and Justin Sun are reportedly among investors looking to acquire a majority stake in crypto exchange Huobi Global.

entry.title: Crypto Exchange Binance Freezes $450,000 From Curve Finance Hack
entry.summary: Binance CEO today reported that the crypto exchange managed to recover roughly 83% of the funds stolen from Curve Finance on Monday.

entry.title: Ethereum Classic Hits 4-Month High as Merge Approaches
entry.summary: The upswing in ETC’s price coincides with the upswing of ETH.

entry.title: Celsius Creditors Move to Block Company From Selling Mined Bitcoin
entry.summary: Celsius creditors have also filed a statement calling CEO Alex Mashinsky's assurances to customers "empty and false promises."

entry.title: Taiwan Turns to Ethereum IPFS Tech to Thwart Chinese Cyberattacks
entry.summary: As tensions with China heat up, Taipei officials leverage decentralized publishing and storage to stay online.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried: 'Disappointing' Others Haven’t Helped Us Give Bailouts
entry.summary: The FTX CEO said he doesn't want to be the only one bailing out ailing crypto companies, but hasn't gotten any help from other healthy players.

entry.title: MakerDAO Founder Calls on DAI to Drop Dollar Peg Amid Tornado Cash Fallout
entry.summary: Over 50% of DAI is currently collateralized by Circle’s USDC.

entry.title: Ethereum Merge May Be Coming Sooner Than Expected
entry.summary: The merge is now expected to take place on September 15 or 16, according to a call today among Ethereum developers.

entry.title: BlackRock Launches Spot Bitcoin Private Trust
entry.summary: The $10 trillion asset manager said it’s also exploring “permissioned blockchains, stablecoins, cryptoassets, and tokenization.”

entry.title: DeFi Exchange dYdX Blocking Addresses Associated With Tornado Cash
entry.summary: The exchange took decisive action to block crypto addresses associated with Tornado Cash following this week’s sanctions blow from the U.S.

entry.title: Curve ‘Strongly Suggests’ Domain Migration to Ethereum Name Service After $570K Frontend Hack
entry.summary: A post-mortem from Curve Finance reported that “no one is safe” from frontend attacks like the one the DeFi exchange suffered on Tuesday.

entry.title: Swan Bitcoin Discloses Data Leak Due to Phishing Attack on Newsletter Provider
entry.summary: Crypto trading app Swan Bitcoin is among dozens of crypto businesses affected by a data breach suffered by email marketing firm Klaviyo.

entry.title: DeFi Token Powering Ethereum Staker Lido Finance Jumps 18%
entry.summary: The token backing popular Ethereum staker Lido jumped double-digits after the final test before the merge next month.

entry.title: Why Musician and NFT Artist Jimmy Edgar Remains Skeptical on Music NFTs
entry.summary: Musician and NFT artist Jimmy Edgar is fully sold on NFT art, but not convinced yet on the uses of NFTs in the music world, he told Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Avalanche's John Wu Talks Institutional Interest and Use Cases
entry.summary: Ava Labs President John Wu sits for an extensive chat about institutional interest in crypto and DeFi (it has "absolutely not waned") and use cases of Avalanche with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Avalanche House in Brooklyn on July 15, 2022.

entry.title: Decrypt on the Street: Chipotle Says ‘Buy the Dip!’
entry.summary:
In our latest Decrypt on the Street segment, reporter Sander Lutz investigates Chipotle’s recent crypto marketing campaign and talks to Chipotle customers about their sadness amid the crypto crash.
Sander himself entered the contest hoping to get rich; instead he got a single cup of queso dip.

entry.title: How Civic Is Battling Web3 Bots and Spam: CPO JP Bedoya
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson reports from NFT Expoverse in LA with JP Bedoya, Chief Product Officer at Civic, the Web3 identity verification problem rolling out a new set of tools to keep people from spamming NFT drops to take advantage.

entry.title: gm: Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon is Finding the 'Soul' in Generative Art NFTs
entry.summary: Art Blocks, the generative NFT series, exploded in popularity and price last fall. Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon (aka "Snowfro") talks to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves all about why the price surge actually hurt Art Blocks and the problem with NFT speculators, the debate over digital art vs. traditional art and his views on Bored Apes and CryptoPunks, how he got into NFTs after starting a physical tile business with his father, and why he thinks everyone's mortgage will eventually be stored on chain.

entry.title: Matthew Ball on the Role of Crypto and NFTs in the Metaverse
entry.summary: The former Amazon Studios exec and venture capitalist spoke with Decrypt’s Kate Irwin about how crypto fits into the metaverse at an event in Beverly Hills, California.
